list.name: Changes
list.comment: refactor: Optimise get_video_stats method to handle multiple video IDs in a single request, reducing API calls and quota usage

task.summary: - created directory structure of the project - main.py -> simple API request to google APIs for getting info of Google developers channel and printing it on the terminal
- created a class YouTubeAPI in youtube_api.py - created a method get_statistics to return Sub counts of a channel
- fix get_statistics bug: use forUsername instead of id for channel lookup - added comments in youtube_api.py and few prints for debugging purposes
add a method to search videos of a channel

Refactor: Extract date calculations to main function
Moved the logic for calculating the RFC 3339 timestamp for six months ago from the YouTubeAPI class to a separate function in the main program. This change improves code modularity and allows for easier testing and maintenance of the date calculation logic.

Refactor get_video_ids to return video IDs
- Added return statement to get_video_ids method to output video IDs - Renamed functions for improved readability - Added comments for better code understanding
refactor: simplify 'get_channel_subs_and_id' method by consolidating exception handling and removing redundancy
refactor: simplify 'get_video_ids_from_channel' method by consolidating exception handling and removing redundancy
feature: Add method to retrieve statistics for multiple videos
refactor: Optimise get_video_stats method to handle multiple video IDs in a single request, reducing API calls and quota usage

MESSAGE.value: - created directory structure of the project - main.py -> simple API request to google APIs for getting info of Google developers channel and printing it on the terminal
- created a class YouTubeAPI in youtube_api.py - created a method get_statistics to return Sub counts of a channel
- fix get_statistics bug: use forUsername instead of id for channel lookup - added comments in youtube_api.py and few prints for debugging purposes
add a method to search videos of a channel

Refactor: Extract date calculations to main function
Moved the logic for calculating the RFC 3339 timestamp for six months ago from the YouTubeAPI class to a separate function in the main program. This change improves code modularity and allows for easier testing and maintenance of the date calculation logic.

- Added return statement to get_video_ids method to output video IDs - Renamed functions for improved readability - Added comments for better code understanding
